src.loader.SuncgLoader module¶

class src.loader.SuncgLoader.SuncgLoader(config)[source]¶

Bases: src.loader.LoaderInterface.LoaderInterface

Loads a house.json file into blender.

  • Loads all objects files specified in the house.json file.
  • Orders them hierarchically (level -> room -> object)
  • Writes metadata into the custom properties of each object

Configuration:

Parameter Description
path The path to the house.json file which should be loaded. Type: string.
suncg_path The path to the suncg root directory which should be used for loading objects, rooms, textures
etc. Type: string. Default: is extracted from the house.json path  
_adjust_material_nodes(mat, adjustments)[source]¶

Adjust the material node of the given material according to the given adjustments.

Textures or diffuse colors will be changed according to the given material_adjustments.

Parameters:
  • mat – The blender material.
  • adjustments – A dict containing a new “diffuse” color or a new “texture” path
_correct_bbox_frame(bbox)[source]¶

Corrects the coordinate frame of the given bbox.

Parameters:bbox – The bbox.
Returns:The corrected bbox.
_get_label_id(obj_id)[source]¶

Returns the label id for an object with the given model_id.

Parameters:obj_id – The model_id of the object.
Returns:The corresponding label index.
_get_type_and_value_from_mat(mat)[source]¶

Returns the type of the material -> either diffuse or with texture (there are only two in SUNCG) :param mat: the material where the type and value should be determined :return mat_type, value: mat_type is either “diffuse” or “texture”, the value contains either name of the

image or the color mapped to an RGB string of the values
_load_box(node, material_adjustments, transform, parent)[source]¶

Creates a cube inside blender which follows the specifications of the given node.

Parameters:
  • node – The node dict which contains information from house.json..
  • material_adjustments – Adjustments to the materials which were specified inside house.json.
  • transform – The transformation that should be applied to the loaded objects.
  • parent – The parent object to which the ground should be linked
_load_ground(node, metadata, material_adjustments, transform, house_id, parent)[source]¶

Load the ground specified in the given node.

Parameters:
  • node – The node dict which contains information from house.json..
  • metadata – A dict of metadata which will be written into the object’s custom data.
  • material_adjustments – Adjustments to the materials which were specified inside house.json.
  • transform – The transformation that should be applied to the loaded objects.
  • house_id – The id of the current house.
  • parent – The parent object to which the ground should be linked
_load_obj(path, metadata, material_adjustments, transform=None, parent=None)[source]¶

Load the wavefront object file from the given path and adjust according to the given arguments.

Parameters:
  • path – The path to the .obj file.
  • metadata – A dict of metadata which will be written into the object’s custom data.
  • material_adjustments – Adjustments to the materials which were specified inside house.json.
  • transform – The transformation that should be applied to the loaded objects.
  • parent – The parent object to which the object should be linked
_load_object(node, metadata, material_adjustments, transform, parent)[source]¶

Load the object specified in the given node.

Parameters:
  • node – The node dict which contains information from house.json..
  • metadata – A dict of metadata which will be written into the object’s custom data.
  • material_adjustments – Adjustments to the materials which were specified inside house.json.
  • transform – The transformation that should be applied to the loaded objects.
  • parent – The parent object to which the ground should be linked
_load_room(node, metadata, material_adjustments, transform, house_id, parent, room_per_object)[source]¶

Load the room specified in the given node.

Parameters:
  • node – The node dict which contains information from house.json..
  • metadata – A dict of metadata which will be written into the object’s custom data.
  • material_adjustments – Adjustments to the materials which were specified inside house.json.
  • transform – The transformation that should be applied to the loaded objects.
  • house_id – The id of the current house.
  • parent – The parent object to which the room should be linked
  • room_per_object – A dict for object -> room lookup (Will be written into)
_read_model_category_mapping(path)[source]¶

Reads in the model category mapping csv.

Parameters:path – The path to the csv file.
_recreate_material_nodes(mat, force_texture)[source]¶

Remove all nodes and recreate a diffuse node, optionally with texture.

This will replace all material nodes with only a diffuse and a texturing node (to speedup rendering).

Parameters:
  • mat – The blender material
  • force_texture – True, if there always should be a texture node created even if the material has at the moment no texture
_rename_materials()[source]¶

Rename all materials based on their texture if they have one

This makes the accessing later on easier

_transform_and_colorize_object(object, material_adjustments, transform=None, parent=None)[source]¶

Applies the given transformation to the object and refactors its materials.

Material is replaced with an existing material if possible or is changed according to the material_adjustments

Parameters:
  • object – The object to use.
  • material_adjustments – A list of adjustments to make. (Each element i corresponds to material_i)
  • transform – The transformation matrix to apply
  • parent – The parent object to which the object should be linked
run()[source]¶
